segments.text: I can't believe how messy this kitchen is getting with all that water overflowing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cabinets and floor are going to be ruined if someone doesn't do something soon.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the water streaming down the fronts of the cabinet doors, creating a widening puddle.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's so frustrating to see such a simple problem causing so much damage.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, drying a plate like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she must be completely oblivious to what's happening around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being so careless, adding to the chaos in the room.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I'm watching a disaster unfold in slow motion.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sink is overflowing, the stool is about to tip, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone comes in and takes control of this situation before it's too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is just such a mess, and it's making me feel really uncomfortable.
segments.speaker: PAR
